name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Coquitlam Inn Convention Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights in mid July. For weekday Gov't rate I paid $119 a night and it was well worth it. There are both motel style exit to the exterior or interior access rooms.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Newly remodeled place

reviews.text: Ther rooms were renovated recently with comfy beds and good linnens. They suffer from the recent hotel phenomenon of thick plush pillows that are painful to sleep on.
reviews.title: Great experience in Coquitlam

likes.disliked: — Everything was way beyond my expectations. I loved everything.

reviews.text: Our room had a fridge and 27" TV. The showers had dispensers for shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. The seperate sink / vainty outside the bathroom was also handy.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay
Disappointing Service
reviews.text: There was an indoor heated pool that we didnt use, but looked ok.
There were several places to eat near by. I would stay here again without question.
reviews.title: July 2005

reviews.text: Great find! The staff is very friendly and welcoming. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with full kitchen and living room. It was very quiet and we felt like we were at home it was so comfortable. The beds are new and the mattresses are very comfortable. Another bonus is the free wireless for the business traveler. The inside pool area is beautiful. This is really the BEST hotel in Coquitlam.
reviews.title: Best In Coquitlam
A great place to stay
reviews.text: What a great hotel. The service was so great and the atmosphere fabulous. While I was there I was able to watch a beautiful wedding right in this huge indoor garden. What a treat!

After a bad experience in Salmon Arm the previous night, it was nice to stay in a quiet hotel for the evening. The fitness area isn't more then two exercise machines in a hallway. The indoor pool is in an unusual place as it's located near the center of the hotel surrounded by all the rooms. I was too tired to use it but enjoyed the restful sleep. Breakfast service at the adjoining restaurant was fast and efficient. I will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the bed, pillows and sheets were brand new and sooo comfy and white as snow.The whole room was practically new and so nice. Opened to the back parking lot or inner courtyard with a pool. Can't say enough nice things about this place. It was busy weekend and I didn't hear a sound all night. The pool and hot tub were really nice. Its close to a great Greek resturant and a liquor store and two resturants on site. The one thing I wish the room had was a microwave, but it had a fridge with a freezer.
reviews.title: WOW. Nicest hotel I've been in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to spend the second half of our trip in Coquitlam as we are planning a move to Canada and wanted to check out the area. We wanted a hotel within easy reach of the Skytrain and public transport close to shops and residential areas. This hotel is 15-20 minutes walk from Lougheed Town Centre Skytrain and bus stations, and the Lougheed Mall.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, good location for factfinding trips

likes.liked: — Clealiness and free services such as phone and internet
likes.disliked: — The fact that receptionist messed up my bill on departure

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very smart with an atrium filled with plants around the pool and sauna. Our room was clean and functional and had clearly been recently refurbished.
reviews.title: The two bedroom suites are great!

likes.liked: — The amenities in the room, location, free wireless high speed internet in rooms
likes.disliked: — Walking through the entire hotel to get to the front desk

reviews.text: There is free wi fi access in the rooms and there is also free internet access close to reception. Local calls from your room are complimentary, and the hotel also provides a free copy of the Vancouver Sun to your door each day.
reviews.title: Consistent

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a family reunion and stayed in one of there suites. The suites had a nice kitchenette and cold sleep 6 people comfortably. Two private rooms and the living room had a pull out couch. The rooms were big, clean and comfortable. The hotel has a great pool/hot tub area that we used a lot. There is tons of parking and the hotel is located minutes to the Trans Canada Highway, and lots of ammenites around including a mall and grocery store. The room service was great to, the Pantry was great for breakfast and dinner and they have another steakhouse as well. Highly recommended for all types of travelers. Very reasonable rates and great value! A+++++
reviews.title: Great value, great location, huge suites

reviews.text: My family of five stayed in a two bedroom suite for one night while travelling through the area on our vacation.
reviews.title: Quiet, Comfortable, Spacious, Clean

reviews.text: We arrived a couple hours before the posted check in time, but after a quick check we were told our suite was ready and were checked in.
reviews.title: Pretty good- but a bit expensive

reviews.text: The suite was spacious and comfortable with two bedrooms (one bed in each) and a pull out couch in the living area. There was also a full kitchen without a dishwasher.
reviews.title: Good value..

reviews.text: The suite was clean and quiet and for just over $200 I found this to be a good value in the Vancouver area.
reviews.title: Overall a nice place, but a bit overpriced.

aka: Best Western Plus Coquitlam Inn Convention Centre Hotel Coquitlam
description: With fresh, newly renovated guestrooms and lobby area, the Best Western Plus Coquitlam redefines the upper midscale hotel experience, blending transitional design with warmth and genuine Westcoast hospitality. Located on the borders of Coquitlam, Burnaby and New Westminster, this Metro Vancouver hotel is minutes from Lougheed Town Centre, light rapid transit, entertainment, outdoor recreation and excellent restaurants and shopping * 2011 Chairman’s Award/Best Western International.
